div.pre: 1926 Lizzano, 20 km. SE of Taranto, Cala- bria, 1950 Burial: c. 340-330 B.C. (K) Contents: 43+ AR, 1 AE Taras: 14 st. (1 hippocamp; 2 Per. II; 10 Per. III; 1 Per. VIII) Metapontum: 6 st. (incl. 1 Leucippus) Poseidonia: 1 st. (Kraay, Atti e Mem. Soc. M. Gr. 1967, p. 121, no. 6) Thurium: 9 st. (incl. 1 Molossus; 1 SNG0x- ford 949; ΙΦΜ on rev.) Velia: 2 st. (1 SNGOxford 1167-8; 1 1169- 74) Caulonia: 6 st. Croton: 3 st. (dumpy incuse, worn) Terina: 2 st. Molossians: 1 AE (thunderbolt on shield/ wreath) Disposition: Taranto Tamburello, AIIN 1954, pp. 163-4 Details noted by K in 1968 If the Taras Per. VIII is excluded as in- trusive, the remainder can be regarded as belonging to a lid, buried in the third quarter of the 4th cent.
